alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hooker (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:53AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Grant and western Hooker Counties through 630 AM MDT... At 553 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whitman, or 26 miles west of Mullen, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whitman, Carr Lake, Duluth and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 150 and 173. Highway 97 between mile markers 59 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
